tutorial.speak:
Surrounding your live stream video, you can have header links and sidebar nav items, with key resources.
In the header, you can add simple links. To do so, click the "Add" button in the Navigation Links section of the Stream Settings page.
Enter the link text and url. It can be any webpage, internal or external. Click "Save" to add it to the header.
The link will appear in the header of your streaming page and open in a new tab when clicked. You can add as many links as you need.
Sidebar tabs appear in the right column of your streaming page and are ways for the user to interact on the page. To add a new tab, click the "Add" button in the Sidebar Tabs section.
Give your tab a name and click the icon drop down and search for a suitable icon. An intuitive icon is especially important for mobile users.
For the page type, there are four options: External Url - Allows you to embed any webpage from any site into a tab. Page - Allows you to create a new custom page with text, images, and links. Chat - Allows viewers of the stream to chat with each other. Prayer - Allows viewers to start a private chat with a prayer team member.
We will choose Chat and click Save.
This will enable a new chat tab on your streaming page.
We'll also add an external page tab for sermon notes, and a prayer request tab.
Before we can add a page tab, we need to first create a new page by clicking the plus icon in the Pages section.
Give it a name and url and click save.
Click on the page to add content.
See the website builder tutorial for details on how to add content to a page.
Now you can add your page as a sidebar tab, by clicking "Add" in the Sidebar Tabs section.
Select Page as the page type and choose the page you just created.
Our streaming page now has tabs for sermon notes...
chat...
prayer requests...
and the offering report...
